title: DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS - Lecturer: Fabio Giglietto - A.Y. 2024/2025 - Credits 6 - UniUrb
snippet: This page describes Fabio Giglietto's course on Digital Social Network Analysis for the academic year 2024/2025, indicating his active role in teaching and research related to social media analysis.
description: This webpage from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo details the Digital Social Network Analysis course taught by Fabio Giglietto for the academic year 2024/2025, showcasing his teaching role within his field of expertise.

title: uniurb.it
description: This is a profile page for Fabio Giglietto on the University of Urbino website. Assuming this page is maintained by the university, it is likely up-to-date and provides a professional overview.

title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - UniUrb
snippet: Lists Fabio Giglietto as Internet Studies professor and chair of vera.ai WP4 at University of Urbino, and mentions his co-authorship of a white paper on the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on data access for platform research. Also mentions a new peer-reviewed publication: 'It takes a village to manipulate the media'.
description: This news item from the University of Urbino mentions Fabio Giglietto as an Internet Studies professor and details his involvement in the vera.ai project and co-authorship of a white paper on the impact of the DSA on data access.

title: A Workflow to Detect, Monitor, and Update Lists of Coordinated Social Media Accounts Across Time - UniUrb
snippet: This article references Fabio Giglietto's previous work on coordinated inauthentic behavior during the 2018 and 2019 Italian elections, and uses his CooRnet tool. It describes a workflow to detect, monitor, and update lists of coordinated social media accounts, applying it to the 2022 Italian snap election.
description: This UniUrb article, found on the uniurb.it domain, mentions Fabio Giglietto and his work on coordinated inauthentic behavior, specifically referencing his previous research and CooRnet tool in the context of the 2022 Italian snap election.

title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil
snippet: Reports on Fabio Giglietto presenting collaborative research on using large language models to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups and moderating a roundtable discussion on data access in the DSA era at conferences in Brazil.
description: This vera.ai post reports on Fabio Giglietto presenting research on disinformation and digital manipulation at conferences in Brazil, specifically using large language models to analyze political discourse and moderating a roundtable on data access.

title: Echo Chambers and Filter Bubbles | Snurblog - Axel Bruns
snippet: Mentions Fabio Giglietto presenting a study of pro-Bolsonaro narratives on Facebook in Brazil at the AoIR 2025 conference, and participating in a roundtable on 'Margins in Motion' as part of the CORIT project at the University of Urbino.
description: The blog post mentions Fabio Giglietto presenting a study on pro-Bolsonaro narratives and participating in a roundtable at the University of Urbino, aligning with his expertise in social media and disinformation.

title: Conference Agenda - | Association of Internet Researchers
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as the chair of a session at the Association of Internet Researchers conference.
description: Fabio Giglietto is listed as the chair of a session at the Association of Internet Researchers (AoIR) conference in 2025, indicating his involvement in the internet research community.

title: A year since the TikTok Messiah's rise, the shock is far from over - EURACTIV.ro
snippet: Mentions data analysis conducted by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi, University of Urbino PROMPT regarding Romanian elections.
description: This Euractiv article discusses the rise of a TikTok influencer and mentions data analysis conducted by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi from the University of Urbino regarding Romanian elections. This indicates a study related to social media and potentially political communication.
